text: can we never get to absolute zero can we
never get to absolute zero what a
wonderful question I wish I had a
wonderful answer to go with it here's
the problem there's there's actually a
law of physics called the third law of
thermodynamics that says you can't get
to Absolute Zero but we don't really
know if it's true but but we're pretty
sure it is for the following reason
every time you think of some way of
cooling something down a little bit it
means you have you're trying to get
energy out of that thing and make the
temperature lower well if you can get
energy out usually there's a way that
energy can go in as well and that always
means that there's a competition between
taking the energy out and putting the
energy in now you can try to make it so
that you are favoring getting energy out
but you can't completely stop the energy
from going in and that means you might
be able to get colder and colder but you
won't be able to get all the way to
absolute zero can we go back to my power
point because I think that that one of
these slides will illustrate that point
a little bit better yes here remember
the logarithmic thermometer there's no
zero on this logarithmic thermometer it
just keeps going down
you make it a factor ten colder you're
not at zero you make it a factor of ten
colder you're still not at zero you make
it a factor of ten colder you're still
not at zero so you start at a millionth
of a degree now you're at a ten million
of a degree now you're at a hundred
millionth of a degree now you're at a
billionth of a degree you never get to
zero that way you get closer and closer
but you never get to zero so that's why
we can't get to absolute zero
